intro: Eurycles javanica, commonly known as the Javanese orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its elegant, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, often found on trees or rocks in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are usually elongated and革质, providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The flowers, which can be white, yellow, or pink, are highly ornamental and attract various pollinators.
